title: James Corden sends a poignant message home to London following Westminster terror attack
text:
James Corden has praised the people of London for their strength in the wake of Wednesdays’ terror attack in an emotional tribute in which he admitted he feels ‘a long, long way from home’.
Stephen Belafonte in drunken rant at LA restaurant following Mel B filing for divorce The presenter, who is from the North West London borough of Hilingdon and currently lives in LA for his late-night TV show, dedicated the introduction of his Late Late Show on Wednesday night to send a poignant message home.
A terror attack in Westminster on Wednesday afternoon has seen five people lose their lives, including an armed policeman and the attacker.
Clearly moved by the day’s events, Corden told his audience: ‘Watching the news today, I felt a really long, long way from home.
‘And it’s funny when something like that happens in your hometown, you don’t have a feeling of being glad that you’re so far away. What you feel is that you wish you could be there with loved ones to stand alongside them.’
The 38-year-old dad of two continued: ‘London is a diverse and proud and brilliant city, and one thing is for sure: If this act of terrorism was supposed to divide the people of London, I know for a fact that all something like this does is bring them closer together as one.
‘Tonight we send our heartfelt thoughts to everybody in Britain. Stay safe everybody, please.’
The area of Westminster was on lockdown on Wednesday after an armed attacker mowed down dozens of pedestrians on Westminster bridge, three of which have tragically died.
The attacker then drove on to the House Of Parliament where he stabbed an armed police officer, Keith Palmer, who devastatingly died from his injuries .

Police confirmed the terrorist, who was shot at the scene after stabbing the police officer, also later died in hospital.
Around 40 people are thought to be injured following the attack.
Made In Chelsea’s Toff was inside the House Of Lords at the time of the attack and she posted a string of live tweets with photos and videos to keep her followers updated.
James Corden's tribute to London ‘I don’t know if anybody saw the news today but there was a terror attack today in my hometown, the city of London, in Wesminster.
‘While we’re filming this, it’s still unknown what the motives were.
‘What we do know at this point is that people have lost their lives and many, many more have been injured.
‘And I know a lot of people in Britain watch this show. There’s a lot of people from Britain who work on this show, and of course, our thoughts go out to everyone who’s been affected by this.
